name: A$AP Rocky
bio: Rapper who revealed a switch to a vegan lifestyle in 2019 after years of pescatarian/vegetarian eating.

name: Aamir Khan
bio: Indian actor-director; went vegan for health and ethics; PETA India Person of the Year 2015

name: Alicia Silverstone
bio: Actress and author of 'The Kind Diet'; raises her son vegan; longtime PETA advocate

name: Ariana Grande
bio: Grammy-winning pop star; animal rescue advocate; went vegan at 19

name: Ava DuVernay
bio: Director of 'Selma' and '13th'; links veganism with social justice

name: Benedict Cumberbatch
bio: Oscar-nominated actor; publicly confirmed plant-based diet during press for Marvel films

name: Billie Eilish
bio: Grammy-winning singer; outspoken on animal welfare and environment; PETA Person of the Year 2021

name: Bryan Adams
bio: Canadian rock musician; advocates 'If you love animals, don’t eat them.'

name: Elliot Page
bio: Actor known for 'Juno' and 'The Umbrella Academy'; outspoken on animal rights and climate

name: Erykah Badu
bio: Neo-soul singer-songwriter who has been vegan since 1997, citing health and energy as key reasons.

name: Evanna Lynch
bio: 'Harry Potter' star; hosts 'The ChickPeeps' podcast; advocates cruelty-free beauty

name: James Cameron
bio: Director of 'Titanic' and 'Avatar'; produced 'The Game Changers'; promotes 'futurevore' eating

name: Jared Leto
bio: Oscar-winning actor and musician; credits vegan diet for health and longevity

name: Jason Mraz
bio: Singer-songwriter who adopted an all-plant-based diet in 2011 and credits it for better health and productivity.

name: Jermaine Dupri
bio: Hip-hop producer and music executive vegan since the early 2000s; active promoter of plant-based living.

name: Joaquin Phoenix
bio: Oscar-winning actor; lifelong ethical vegan; spoke against dairy cruelty in 2020 Oscars speech

name: Lenny Kravitz
bio: Rock legend who follows a vegan, largely raw diet and promotes sustainability through home-grown produce.

name: Leona Lewis
bio: British pop singer raised vegetarian who went fully vegan in 2012; outspoken animal-rights advocate.

name: Lewis Hamilton
bio: Seven-time F1 world champion; co-founded Neat Burger; vocal about climate and animal issues

name: Maggie Q
bio: Actor known for 'Nikita'; went vegan after learning about animal cruelty; longtime PETA ambassador

name: Mayim Bialik
bio: Actress and neuroscientist known for using her platform to advocate for veganism and animal welfare.

name: Moby
bio: Musician and animal activist who's 'vegan for life' and uses his platform to educate on animal rights.

name: Morrissey
field: Musician; Former lead singer of The Smiths
bio: English singer-songwriter and former frontman of The Smiths; outspoken animal rights advocate; went vegetarian in childhood and adopted a vegan diet around 2015; known for banning meat at his concerts.

name: Mýa
bio: Grammy-winning R&B artist who became vegan in 2014 and created resources to help others go plant-based.

name: Natalie Portman
bio: Oscar-winning actress; went vegan after reading 'Eating Animals'; produced the documentary adaptation

name: Pamela Anderson
bio: Actor and animal-rights advocate; PETA Person of the Year 2016; campaigns against fur and animal testing

name: RZA
bio: Wu-Tang Clan leader; phased to vegan by 1997; advocates respect for all life

name: Sadie Sink
bio: 'Stranger Things' actor; mentored by Woody Harrelson; went vegan at 14

name: Sonam Kapoor
bio: Bollywood star; turned vegan in 2018; PETA India Person of the Year 2018

name: Stevie Wonder
bio: Music icon; went vegan for health and environment; promotes sustainability

name: Tobey Maguire
bio: Actor known for 'Spider-Man'; vegetarian since 1992, fully vegan since 2009

name: Tony Kanal
bio: No Doubt bassist who went vegan in 2012 and actively supports animal-rights causes.

name: Travis Barker
bio: Blink-182 drummer; credits vegan diet post-2008 for energy and recovery; co-founded vegan ventures

name: Will.i.am
bio: Black Eyed Peas frontman who went vegan in 2017 after health scares and has since advocated for animals.

name: Ricky Gervais
bio: British comedian, actor, and creator of 'The Office'; long-time animal rights advocate who went fully vegan in 2024, citing ethical concerns about animal exploitation.

name: Woody Harrelson
bio: Actor and environmental activist; credited with inspiring co-stars like Sadie Sink to go vegan
